availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Rockcastle County, merchant, soldier, and circuit clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Smith. Father of Sarah Smith, Martha M. Smith, and Alfred Smith. Merchant in Rockcastle County in 1850. Sheriff of Rockcastle County before 1860. Clerk of the Rockcastle County Court in Rockcastle County in 1860. Major in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from August 21, 1862 to March 24, 1864. Clerk of the Rockcastle Circuit Court in Rockcastle County from 1864 to 1867.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, District Not Stated, p. 1.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 372.
Organization Index to Pension Files of Veterans who served between 1861 and 1900, Fold3, Civil War Pensions Index, roll no. 57.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1864,” in 1865 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 9-12.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865,” in 1865/66 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 9-12.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mt. Vernon, p. 2.
